But don't you want a Prestige version of every current and future Lux skin? Tell me with a straight face you wouldn't buy them.

Now tell me with a straight face that too few people would buy them for Riot to justify producing and releasing them.
It would be funny to have prestige elementalist Lux.  All the forms would look pretty much the same.

Star Guardian Lux is the only skin I need

But I wouldn't doubt that Riot would try that

To be fair, the latest patch was pretty good, and they're further addressing Irelia's kit and Akali's kit.

I think Akali is going to be gutted after 9.3 if her Q heal really is removed, and Irelia is going to be more niche but definitely still viable, and even more powerful in some circumstances.

Plus vi buffs and partial crit rework after more than 6 months.
I thought it was, "wrong button,"  "not the right button,"  and "what did this button do again?"
Green button still a no go.

Talking to top players and considering well thought-out posts on fan sites is integral to game health.

You have a resource of millions of players, thousands of whom have basically dedicated their entire lives to this game and have become experts of it for the past decade.  

They aren't the end-all-be-all of balancing the game, but they do add context to numbers and can help point out disparities in 'feel' versus 'data' (like how Akali can't win games but she's nearly universally reviled, Garen can be near 50% winrate yet people think his power should be shifted around, etc...).

To be clear, i was kinda memeing, as part of the community is dissatisfied with balance despite Riot **already listening to players**.

So, yeah, listening to players is an important part of the process, but that's not enough to appease the screaming minority thinking they can do a better work than developers granted better experience and contacts, and having to deal with a responsibility many players couldn't handle.
Some players don't have a clue about the complexity of this job and they don't see they'll never be satisfied with their attitude.

That's why I say the green button won't fix anything. It's already pushed and people still don't look happy with it. For what I know, none of these buttons would work for them.
